bug.author: Avens666
bug.description:
Hi I build carla 0.9.9 on Win10 + VS2017 + UE4.24 +Python38 I run make launch to build server succeed. and I can use UE4 package carla. But make Python failed There is error when link : libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(exception.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(codecvt_error_category.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(directory.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(path_traits.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(operations.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(path.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __CxxFrameHandler4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(exception.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(codecvt_error_category.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(directory.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(path_traits.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(operations.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 libboost_filesystem-vc141-mt-x64-1_72.lib(path.obj) : error LNK2001: Unresolved external symbols __GSHandlerCheck_EH4 anyone had same error like me? How to fix it. Thank ! It is link command ''' "d:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.16.27023 in\HostX86\x64\link.exe" /nologo /INCREMENTAL:NO /LTCG /DLL /MANIFEST:EMBED,ID=2 comments.comment: I have encountered this issue myself and have not found a workaround (besides switching to a different computer). This problem was also reported by another user in this issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla/issues/2741>#2741</denchmark-link>

Thank you for your reply. I try 2 computer, one had VS2019 and VS2017, one only has VS2017. but had the same problem. maybe try another computer or wait next calar version. now I use the python lib in release version 0.9.9.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bernatx>@bernatx</denchmark-link> you are our Windows expert. Any idea?
We recently found similar problems with boost and the last version of Python. Try with Python 3.7.2 and be sure it is the x64 version. Tell us if that works for any of you. Thanks
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
